bioghist.p: The Needlework Guild of America was founded in Philadelphia in 1885. The Guild's mission was to make and distribute new garments for the needy. Members were required to produce at least two garments a year to maintain active membership in the Guild. As it grew, many branches were added, but the Philadelphia branch retained its identity as the "parent branch."

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the Needlework Guild of America. Manuscript materials in the collection include: minutes of the Executive Committee of the Philadelphia Branch, 1902-1920; Treasurer's Account book with the Philadelphia Branch, 1897-1933; and minutes of Annual Meetings of Section President, 1917-1928. Printed materials include bound copies of annual and biennial reports for the national group from 1885-1938, and annual and biennial reports for the Philadelphia Branch for 1891-1953. Additionally, there are 8 photographs of the guild members and exhibits promoting their work.
